data.title: On Screen: March 24, 2017
authors: Compiled  Jenny Porter Tilley, The Herald-Times
data.meta_description: Movies playing in Bloomington and the surrounding area this week.
data.text:
Movies playing in Bloomington and the surrounding area this week.

Special showings

At the Ryder, “Things to Come” stars Isabelle Huppert as a Parisian philosophy teacher juggling life’s demands. Her world is turned upside down when her husband announces he plans to leave her. Also showing is “Fire at Sea” and “Tanna.”

At 12:55 p.m. Saturday at AMC 11 East, see the Metropolitan Opera’s production of “Idomeneo.” The Met in HD series brings high-definition broadcasts of Met operas to movie theater screens. See www.metoperafamily.org for more.

“Rahsaan Roland Kirk: The Case of the Three Sided Dream” will be screened at 3 p.m. Sunday at the IU Cinema. The screening will include a post-film discussion featuring the documentary’s director and family members Dorthaan Kirk and Rory Kirk. “The Love of Mr. Ann” will be screened at 7 p.m. Friday as part of the China Remixed series. Also showing this weekend are “Toni Erdmann,” “Om Shanti Om,” “Mama Rainbow” and “Papa Rainbow.”

Playing

“Badrinath Ki Dulhania” (NR, 139 min.) Differing views on gender and life don’t stop a man and a woman from falling in love. With Varun Dhawan and Alia Bhatt. (AMC 11 East)

“Beauty and the Beast” (PG, 130 min.) The classic animated Disney movie comes to life with Emma Watson starring as Belle. She is held prisoner by the Beast inside his enchanted castle where she finds love. With Dan Stevens and Luke Evans. (AMC 11 East, AMC 12 West, Tivoli Theatre)

“Before I Fall” (R, 99 min.) Sam is just a typical teen living a typical life. But on Feb. 12, her last day on Earth, she finds herself living the day over and over again with the same tragic end. With Zoey Deutch, Liv Hewson and Jennifer Beals. (AMC 11 East)

“The Belko Experiment” (R, 88 min.) Employees of the Belko Corp. in Colombia find themselves in danger when they’re trapped inside and being told that workers need to be killed in order for others to survive. With John Gallagher Jr., Tony Goldwyn and Adria Arjona. (AMC 12 West)

“CHiPS” (R, 101 min.) California Highway Patrol’s Ponch and Jon make an appearance on the big screen with this reboot of the late ‘70s television series. With Dax Shepard, Michael Pena and Adam Brody. (AMC 11 East, AMC 12 West)

“Get Out” (R, 104 min.) Chris and Rose are in that phase of a relationship when it is time to meet the parents. Chris mistakes her parents’ behavior for nervousness over the interracial relationship. But as time goes on, he realizes something more sinister is behind their actions. With Daniel Kaluuya, Allison Williams and Bradley Whitford. (AMC 11 East, AMC 12 West)

“Hidden Figures” (PG, 126 min.) A trio of African-American women work at NASA and are the brains behind the launch of astronaut John Glenn into orbit. With Taraji P. Henson, Octavia Spencer and Janelle Monae. (AMC 11 East)

“Kong: Skull Island” (PG-13, 118 min.) How did Kong become king? A science expedition to an unchartered island discovers the home of the king of the apes. With Tom Hiddleston, Brie Larson and Samuel L. Jackson. (AMC 11 East, AMC 12 West)

“The Lego Batman Movie” (PG, 105 min.) In order for Batman to save Gotham from the Joker, he may have to learn to work with others. With voices by Will Arnett, Zach Galifianakis and Michael Cera. (AMC 11 East, AMC 12 West)

‘Life’ (R, 103 min.) Scientists on the International Space Station find a life form that resulted in extinction on Mars. The life form now threatens the crew and everyone on Earth. With Jake Gyllenhaal and Ryan Reynolds. (AMC 11 East, AMC 12 West)

“Logan” (R, 141 min.) A tired Logan hides out along the Mexican border as he cares for Professor X. But when a young mutant arrives, he must swing back into action. With Hugh Jackman, Patrick Stewart and Dafne Keen. (AMC 11 East, AMC 12 West)

“Power Rangers” (PG-13, 124 min.) Four ordinary high school students suddenly find themselves learning how to deal with their new superpowers. And they need to learn fast in order to save the world. With Dacre Montgomery, Naomi Scott and RJ Cyler. (AMC 11 East, AMC 12 West)

“The Red Turtle” (PG, 80 min.) In this animated film with no dialogue, a castaway on a deserted island goes through his life surrounded by turtles, crabs and birds. (AMC 11 East)

“Rogue One: A Star Wars Story” (PG-13, 133 min.) In this latest “Star Wars” installment, a band of heroes work to steal the plans for the Death Star. With Felicity Jones, Diego Luna and Mads Mikkelsen. (Union Board Film Series)

“The Shack” (PG-13, 132 min.) Mack Phillips is grieving the death of his daughter. He then receives a strange invitation to meet God. With Sam Worthington, Octavia Spencer and Tim McGraw. (AMC 12 West, Brown County Playhouse)

“Table 19” (PG-13, 87 min.) Despite recent setbacks, Eloise pushes forward to attend her oldest friend’s wedding. Finding herself seated with other invitees who probably should have stayed home, she learns a thing or two about life. With Anna Kendrick, Lisa Kudrow and Wyatt Russell. (AMC 11 East)

Movie houses

Local film venues and series; call for times and details.

BLOOMINGTON

AMC Showplace 11, east: 1351 S. College Mall Road; AMC Showplace 12, west: 2929 W. Third St., 323-0796, www.amcentertainment.com

Buskirk-Chumley Theater, 114 E. Kirkwood Ave., 812-323-3020, www.buskirkchumley.org

IU Cinema, 1213 E. Seventh St., 812-855-7632, www.cinema.indiana.edu

Ryder Film Series, 812-727-0775, www.theryder.com

Union Board Film Series, IMU’s Whittenberg Auditorium, 812-855-4682, www.imu.indiana.edu

Starlite Drive-In, 7640 S. Old Ind. 37, 812-824-CARS. http://starlitebloomington.com

MARTINSVILLE

Centerbrook Drive-In, 6735 Ind. 67 North, Martinsville, 317-831-1526, www.centerbrookmovies.com

MITCHELL

Holiday Drive-In, 1055 Ind. 37, Mitchell, 812-849-4992, www.holidaydrivein.biz

NASHVILLE

Brown County Playhouse, 70 S. Van Buren St., 812-988-6555, www.browncountyplayhouse.org

SPENCER

Cinema 67 Drive-In, R.R.2, Spencer, 812-879-4240, www.cinema67.com

Tivoli Theatre, 28 N. Washington St., Spencer, 812-714-8069, http://spencertivoli.org
